hints.content: To help us solve a division problem, we can rewrite it as a multiplication problem:$\color{blue}\square\color{black} \div 7= 7$ $~~$ because  $~~$ $7\times7=\color{blue}\square\color{black}$.
$\color{blue}{49}\color{black} \div 7= 7$ $~~$ because  $~~$ $7\times7=\color{blue}{49}\color{black}$.
$7\times7=\color{blue}\square\color{black}$ can help us find the unknown number  in $\color{blue}\square\color{black} \div 7= 7$.

question.content: **Which equation can help us find the unknown number in $\color{blue}\square\color{black} \div 7= 7~?$**

hints.content:
Multiplication and division are related:
$\color{green}\text{number of groups}\color{black} \times \color{maroon}\text{size of groups}\color{black} = \color{purple}\text{total}\color{black} $
$\color{maroon}\text{size of groups}\color{black} \times \color{green}\text{number of groups}\color{black} = \color{purple}\text{total}\color{black} $

$\color{purple}\text{total}\color{black} \div \color{green}\text{number of groups}\color{black} =\color{maroon}\text{size of groups}\color{black} $
$\color{purple}\text{total}} \div \color{maroon}\text{size of groups}} =\color{green}\text{number of groups}}$

In ${\color{green}4\color{black}\color{black} = \color{purple}{?}\color{black} \div \color{maroon}{9}\color{black}$, the $\color{green}\text{number of the groups}\color{black}$ is $\color{green}4\color{black}$.The $\color{maroon}\text{size of the groups}\color{black}$ is ${\color{maroon}9\color{black}\color{black}$. [[https://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/cbd6b25fd98290ea45963548600d23f1bbbf8b16.svg]] The $\color{purple}\text{total}}$ is $\color{purple}?}$.

Kiley can use these multiplication equations:- $\color{purple}{?}\color{black} = \color{green}4\color{black} \times \color{maroon}{9}\color{black}$
- $\color{purple}{?}\color{black} = \color{maroon}9\color{black} \times \color{green}{4}}$

question.content: Kiley wants to use multiplication to solve $4 = {?} \div 9$.**Which two multiplication equations can Kiley use?**

hints.content:
Multiplication and division are related:
$\color{green}\text{number of groups}\color{black} \times \color{maroon}\text{size of groups}\color{black} = \color{purple}\text{total}\color{black} $
$\color{maroon}\text{size of groups}\color{black} \times \color{green}\text{number of groups}\color{black} = \color{purple}\text{total}\color{black} $

$\color{purple}\text{total}\color{black} \div \color{green}\text{number of groups}\color{black} =\color{maroon}\text{size of groups}\color{black} $
$\color{purple}\text{total}} \div \color{maroon}\text{size of groups}} =\color{green}\text{number of groups}}$

In this fact family, the $\color{green}\text{number of the groups}\color{black}$ is $\color{green}9\color{black}$.The $\color{maroon}\text{size of the groups}\color{black}$ is ${\color{maroon}8\color{black}\color{black}$. [[https://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/9633294bf38711b44854aa315c1fe1e7e508d072.svg]] The $\color{purple}\text{total}}$ is $\color{purple}?}$.
The equation $\color{purple}{?}\color{black} = \color{green}9\color{black} \times {\color{maroon}8\color{black}\color{black}$ can help us find the unknown number.

question.content: **Create an equation to help us find the unknown number in ${?} \div 9 = 8$ .** $= 9\times{}$

hints.content:
Multiplication and division are related:
$\color{green}\text{number of groups}\color{black} \times \color{maroon}\text{size of groups}\color{black} = \color{purple}\text{total}\color{black} $
$\color{maroon}\text{size of groups}\color{black} \times \color{green}\text{number of groups}\color{black} = \color{purple}\text{total}\color{black} $

$\color{purple}\text{total}\color{black} \div \color{green}\text{number of groups}\color{black} =\color{maroon}\text{size of groups}\color{black} $
$\color{purple}\text{total}} \div \color{maroon}\text{size of groups}} =\color{green}\text{number of groups}}$

In ${\color{maroon}9\color{black}\color{black} = \color{purple}{?}\color{black} \div \color{green}{6}\color{black}$, the $\color{green}\text{number of the groups}\color{black}$ is $\color{green}6\color{black}$.The $\color{maroon}\text{size of the groups}\color{black}$ is ${\color{maroon}9\color{black}\color{black}$. [[https://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/d7c2700709200e98cc30f84e8ca6e17aa1cc6bb7.svg]] The $\color{purple}\text{total}}$ is $\color{purple}?}$.

Tony can use these multiplication equations:- $\color{purple}{?}\color{black} = \color{green}6\color{black} \times \color{maroon}{9}\color{black} $
- $\color{purple}{?}\color{black} = \color{maroon}9\color{black} \times \color{green}{6}}$

hints.content: To help us solve a division problem, we can rewrite it as a multiplication problem:$21\div\color{blue}\blacklozenge\color{black} = 7$ $~~$ because  $~~$ $\color{blue}\blacklozenge\color{black}\times7=21$.
$21\div\color{blue}3 = 7$ $~~$ because  $~~$ $\color{blue}3\times7=21$.
$\color{blue}\blacklozenge\color{black} \times 7 = 21$ can help us find the unknown number in $21 \div \color{blue}\blacklozenge\color{black}= 7.$
